intro: Wiborgia brachystephana, commonly known as the short-step wiborgia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers, and is characterized by its showy, blue to violet-colored tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Wiborgia brachystephana is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens that mimic its natural habitat.
